model

Class SimpleAIPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • model.Player
        • model.SimpleAIPlayer

  • public class SimpleAIPlayer
extends Player
    Simple AI that makes decisions based on a random generator. Easiest AI to beat
    Author:
    Steven Broussard, Elizabeth Harris, Jeremy Jalnos, Becca Simon

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SimpleAIPlayer()
      Constructs a new SimpleAIPlayer using the default no-argument constructor
      SimpleAIPlayer(java.lang.String name)
      Constructs a new SimpleAIPlayer with the parameter as the player's name

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Territory attackFrom()
      Randomly chooses a territory that the player owns to attack from.
      Territory attackTo(Territory attacker)
      Determines the territory that is being attacked by finding an adjacent territory that is owned by another player.
      void placeArmy()
      At the beginning of the game, randomly chooses empty territories to place an army in.
      void reinforceArmies()
      Randomly chooses territories to move armies from and to, and the number of armies to move.

    • Method Detail

      • attackFrom

        public Territory attackFrom()
        Randomly chooses a territory that the player owns to attack from. The territory must have at least two armies.
        Specified by:
        attackFrom in class Player
        Returns:
        The territory that the player is attacking from.

      • attackTo

        public Territory attackTo(Territory attacker)
        Description copied from class: Player
        Determines the territory that is being attacked by finding an adjacent territory that is owned by another player.
        Specified by:
        attackTo in class Player
        Parameters:
        attacker - The territory that the player is attacking from. Randomly chooses a territory to attack. The territory to attack must be adjacent to the parameter and owned by a different player
        Returns:
        The territory that that the player is attacking

      • placeArmy

        public void placeArmy()
        At the beginning of the game, randomly chooses empty territories to place an army in. Each time this method is called, the player is placing one territory. After all territories have one army on it, this randomly places an army in a territory that is currently owned.
        Specified by:
        placeArmy in class Player

      • reinforceArmies

        public void reinforceArmies()
        Randomly chooses territories to move armies from and to, and the number of armies to move.
        Specified by:
        reinforceArmies in class Player
